result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Follak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael A. Follak is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael A. Follak was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber and work crew are authorized.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A. Follak

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: For Ct 2 only - Dismissed.
Amended to $518.00 DNA of $250 charged.
DE was sentenced on 6/16/15 and court is also requiring him to submit to a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.
For Ct 2 only - Dismissed.
$278.00 due in 30 days or civil judgment.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Michael A. Follak, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Count 1- DE is sentenced to 60 days in the KCJ commencing on 6/27/15 at 8:00 AM.  Huber & Work Crew privileges are authorized.  Court costs are due in 30 days or Civil Judgment.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Michael A. Follak, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
Atty Watson states DE missed court because he was at the hospital.  Bench warrant previously authorized is vacated (not yet issued) and bond is reinstated.  DE doesn't have proof and is instructed to make his court appearances.  Sentencing on 6/16/15 at 3:30 PM.
Voluntary appearance requested by Atty Watson so Warrant will remain stayed until tomorow to allow Voluntary Appearance on 6/2 at 8:30 AM.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Attorney Kristyne Watson appeared on behalf of defendant who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
Defendant fails to appear in court.  Court authorizes a Bench Warrant with a $5000 Cash Bond but will stay it until Monday and which time prior bond will be forfeited.
Sentencing hearing on May 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Due to a sentencing that is scheduled for 10:30 in another case on 5/28/15  time changed to 11:00 AM per confirmation from Atty Watson

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Count 2 - Dismissed by the State.  No request for PSI.  Atty Watson requests sentencing be adjourned to allow DE time to get things in order; no objection by the State.  Sentencing on 5/28/15 at 10:30 AM.
DE called to request a six week adjournment to his sentencing hearing, referred to defense Atty Watson.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
Atty Watson withdraws motion to suppress.  Hearing is adjourned for a Plea & Sentencing on 4/15/15 at 11:00 AM as parties will be waiving a PSI.
Per agreement between Atty Watson and the DA's Office the FPT on 1/22/15 has been canceled since a motion to suppress is scheduled for 3/6/15.
Per confirmation with Atty Watson; Motion Hearing on 3/6/15 at 11:00 AM.
filed by Atty Watson

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Kristyne Watson. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Watson. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 1-22-15 @ 9:30am. Bond continued.
Scheduling Order
of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Watson. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing
Filed by Atty:  K Watson.
Atty:  K Watson.

215 p.m.  Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.   Clk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 12/3/14 @ 915 a.m.  $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *No Weapons.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No discussion of this case w/ Amber G.
961.41(3g)(e) POss of THC - 2nd & Subs, Repeater   /   941.23(2) Carrying Concealed Weapon, Repeater
